main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Montezuma, Indiana on 20 November 1957, involving a white, irregular object, possibly a balloon or aircraft, moving in an easterly direction through the clouds and being lost to sight at an altitude of 7,000 feet.
interesting points: The sighting involved a single object, described as white, irregular, and possibly a balloon or aircraft, moving through the clouds in an easterly direction.
The object was observed at 7,000 feet altitude before being lost to sight, lasting for a duration of approximately 10 minutes.
The document suggests that the sighting was probably a balloon or aircraft, but due to insufficient data, the evaluation remains inconclusive.
Witnesses reported the object as a bright light moving from east to west, reaching an altitude of 57 feet and lasting for 1-2 minutes, before appearing to move upward through the clouds.
An interim report was requested due to the inability to make a determination based on the individual study of the sighting.
sighted object: irregular white object moving through the clouds
